info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 6:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN MECKLENBURG... CUMBERLAND...EASTERN PRINCE EDWARD...LUNENBURG...NOTTOWAY...AMELIA AND POWHATAN COUNTIES THROUGH 745 PM EDT... At 643 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Sunnyside to Chase City. Movement was northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Crewe, Victoria, Lunenburg, Burkeville, Sunnyside, Morven, Ballsville, Kells Corner, Green Bay, and Tobaccoville around 650 PM EDT. Jetersville around 655 PM EDT. Macon and Trenholm around 700 PM EDT. Powhatan and Kenbridge around 705 PM EDT. Amelia Courthouse and Nottoway around 710 PM EDT. Chula around 720 PM EDT. Blackstone around 725 PM EDT. Scotts Fork around 730 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bacons Fork, North Wellville, Wilburn, Angola, Arvins Store, Murdocks, Nutbush, Finneywood, Forksville, and Hawk. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
